alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 10:38AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL ALBANY AND SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 1037 AM MST...An area of heavy snow was affecting portions of eastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties. Periods of heavy snowfall will persist through 1145 AM MST. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and visibilities less than one half mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Federal, Granite Springs Campground, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Horse Creek and Crystal Lake Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 325 and 355. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Roads may suddenly become icy. Take extra precautions by slowing down and increasing the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
